H0.text: Hypha is the structure from which conidiospores, unicellular or multicellular asexual spores, are released directly from the tip or side.

H1.text: Ganglion is the structure from which unicellular or multicellular conidiospores, a type of asexual spore, are released directly from the tip or side.

H2.text: Idioma is the structure from which conidiospores, which are unicellular or multicellular asexual spores, are released directly from the tip or side.

H3.text: Goychay is the tip or side from which conidiospores—unicellular or multicellular asexual spores—are released.

A4.text: Asexual reproduction in ascomycetes (the phylum Ascomycota) is by the formation of conidia, which are borne on specialized stalks called conidiophores.
